S. 3130 (115th) was a bill in the United States Congress.
A bill must be passed by both the House and Senate in identical form and
then be signed by the President to become law.
Bills numbers restart every two years. That means there are other bills
with the number S. 3130. This is the one from the 115^th Congress.
This bill was introduced in the 115^th Congress, which met from Jan 3,

GovTrack automatically collects legislative information from a variety of
governmental and non-governmental sources. This page is sourced primarily
from Congress.gov, the official portal of the United States Congress.
Congress.gov is generally updated one day after events occur, and so
legislative activity shown here may be one day behind. Data via the
Launched in 2004, GovTrack helps everyone learn about and track the
activities of the United States Congress. This is a project of Civic
Impulse, LLC. GovTrack.us is not a government website.
You are encouraged to reuse any material on this site.
Hackers/journalists/researchers: See these open data sources.
GovTrack.us is an independent website tracking the status of legislation
in the United States Congress and helping you participate in government.

If you’ve visited a bill page on GovTrack.us recently, you may have
noticed a new “study guide” tab located just below the bill title. This is
